meanings.definition: Relating to or used in angiography.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used an angiographic dye to see inside the patient's blood vessels.
meanings.sent2: The angiographic procedure helped identify the blockage in the artery.
meanings.sent3: The angiographic tool was so colorful, it looked like a rainbow in the body.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like angiographic lenses, seeing through the complexities of the circulatory system.
meanings.sent5: The angiographic image was as clear as looking through a window into the veins.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the process of producing an angiogram.
meanings.sent1: The technician prepared the angiographic equipment for the imaging procedure.
meanings.sent2: The angiographic film captured detailed images of the blood flow.
meanings.sent3: During the test, the angiographic machine beeped like a friendly robot.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like an angiographic camera, capturing every detail of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The angiographic results were like pieces of a puzzle, fitting together perfectly.

meanings.definition: Involving the visualization of blood vessels using radiographic techniques.
meanings.sent1: The angiographic scan revealed the intricate network of blood vessels in the brain.
meanings.sent2: Doctors relied on angiographic technology to guide their surgical interventions.
meanings.sent3: The angiographic process felt like a magical journey through the body's highways.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an angiographic map, navigating the paths of the circulatory system.
meanings.sent5: The angiographic view was like a mesmerizing dance of colors in the veins.
